sources.name: Smithsonian SOS
notes: Retrieved data from online portal.
May also need to scrape additional metadata from full record: example
Dates look like a non-standardized mix of commissioned, installed, and dedicated

sources.name: HMdb
sources.verboseName: HMdb Historical Markers and War Memorials
notes: No clearcut way to identify monuments; will mostly likely need to infer from the name and text fields.
Subjects and marker text ingested from individual item web pages (see ./scripts/hmdb/ in code repository).

sources.name: Open Street Map
sources.verboseName: Open Street Map Points of Interest: Historic Monuments and Memorials
notes: Combines two OSM tags: historic:monument and historic:memorial
There is a very long tail of metadata, most of which don't have a lot of coverage.
Processed using QuickOSM plug-in on QGIS. Documentation here.
Needed to manually fix osm ids; for some reason there were thousands of entries with the same osm_id
Manually downloaded historic:monument where type=Way from Overpass since only type=Node was retrieved from QuickOSM

sources.name: MassGIS Data
notes: Source data was re-projected from GCS North American 1983 to WGS 84 Lat/Lon coordinates using QGIS
Large amount of data initially; filtered by type 'Object'.

sources.name: NYC Parks Monuments
sources.provider: NYC Department of Parks and Recreation
notes: Re-projected data to WGS 84 with QGIS

sources.name: WWIMIP
sources.verboseName: The World War I Memorial Inventory Project
sources.provider: The World War I Memorial Inventory Project
notes: Source data scraped from web html
Unclear if date is referring to dedication or construction date

sources.name: Whose Heritage?
sources.verboseName: Whose Heritage? Public Symbols of the Confederacy
sources.dataPath: data/vendor/national/Whose Heritage SF - Whose Heritage Master.csv
notes: Monuments are clearly labelled by 'Symbol Type'.

sources.name: NPS National Register
sources.verboseName: National Park Service: National Register of Historic Places
notes: Additional lat/lon data is taken from this dataset which is missing about a third of the full dataset. See scripts/national/nps/merge_sources.py script that combines them.
Not 100% about dates; there are fields called Status_Date, Listed_Date, and SRC_DATE which looks to all be the same thing; I don't think this is either dedication or construction dates
There are sorts of types: buildings, structures (e.g. bridges), districts, sites, and objects

sources.name: Commemorative Landscapes of North Carolina
notes: Source data scraped from web html

sources.name: NPS POIs
sources.verboseName: National Park Service: Points of Interest
sources.filter: POITYPE=Historic Building OR POITYPE=Historic Marker OR POITYPE=Historic Site OR POITYPE=Historic Ruins OR POITYPE=Memorial OR POITYPE=Monument OR POITYPE=Monument or Memorial OR POITYPE=Sculpture
notes: Only taking entries that are considered historic, monuments, memorials, and sculptures
There are no dates that look reliable
